intro: Vaccinium yaoshanicum, commonly known as the Yaoshan blueberry, is a species of shrub native to China. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and small trees known for their acidic soils preferences. The plant produces small, edible berries that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
